findings.title: Liability cap carve-outs may negate protection
findings.rationale: Liability caps that exclude indemnity, confidentiality, or IP claims often negate the practical benefit of the cap entirely.
findings.matched_excerpt: ...5. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY Liability is capped at the greater of $1,000,000 or the annual contract value, except for indemnification obligations....
findings.context:
r Client's internal business purposes only.

4. INDEMNIFICATION
Mutual indemnification: each party indemnifies the other for claims arising from its own negligence, capped at the annual contract value.

5. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY
Liability is capped at the greater of $1,000,000 or the annual contract value, except for indemnification obligations.

6. TERM AND TERMINATION
Either party may terminate for convenience with 9

changes: Added 8 high-signal rules (attorneys fees, liability cap carveouts, assignment restrictions, etc.)
Implemented clause-level anchoring and false-positive suppression
